title: 最後戰線： 告爆香港警察

replies.msg:
I am writing to suggest the HKUSU/ CUSU/ HKPUSU/ CityU SU/ HKBUSU to file a lawsuit on the Hong Kong Police Force for violating the rights to privacy of HK citizens according to Article 29 of the Basic Law (Constitution of HKSAR) by entering university premises without search warrant.

Article 29
The homes and other premises of Hong Kong residents shall be inviolable. Arbitrary or unlawful search of, or intrusion into, a resident’s home or other premises shall be prohibited.

Although all university area is not explicitly the" homes and other premises of Hong Kong residents”, but it was reiterated that

“The fact that ordinances creating a right to search private premises normally require the law enforcement agency to seek a warrant itself indicates recognition on the part of the legislature that this intrusion into the citizen’s right of privacy requires supervision by the judiciary in order to ensure that it is not abused or used cavalierly.” (paragraph 120, CIVIL APPEAL NOs 97 & 107 OF 2015) in the high court of the Hong Kong special administrative region court of appeal.

I also found a short summary on the case for your reference:
在海關關長針對原訟法庭 2014 年 12 月 2 3 日 和 2015 年 4 月 1 6 日的判決提出的上 訴及申請人提出的交相上訴中，委聘一名 本地資深大律師及兩名本地大律師代表 海關關長所支付的費用和開支。有關的根 本司法覆核質疑海關關長執行的搜查令 是否有效。上訴的爭議點之一是質疑，就 《 香 港 人 權 法 案 》第 十 四 條 (有關對私生活 的保護 )和《基本法》第二十九條 (有關禁 止任意搜查房屋 )而言，《進出口條例》 (第 60 章 )第 21(1)( a )條 (下稱「 條 文 」 )賦 予海關關長權力在沒有手令的情況下搜 查非住用處所，是否合憲。上訴及交相上 訴的聆訊在 2016 年 3 月 1 5 至 1 7 日同時 進行。上訴法庭在 2016 年 4 月 2 2 日宣布 判 決 ， 裁 定 條文違憲，並應用補救解釋， 使其符合《基本法》的規定。(財務委員會參考文件)

The judgement of this appeal shows that the nature of entering private premises (of residence or non-residence) without search warrant by law enforcers "goes against the constitution” (see Chinese citation above, and paragraph 93).
Despite HKPF might have the right to enter university premises according to the Public Order Ordinance, the constitution of HKSAR, the Basic Law is above all laws according to Article 8 of the Basic Law; and when the other laws contravenes the Basic Law it shall be subjected to amendment and are deemed invalid:

Article 8
The laws previously in force in Hong Kong, that is, the common law, rules of equity, ordinances, subordinate legislation and customary law shall be maintained, except for any that contravene this Law, and subject to any amendment by the legislature of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

(Continued)

To sum up, the Public Order Ordinance and other arguments from the HKPF from the Police Force Ordinance on their “right” to search the university without a search warrant is to no avail, under the Basic Law according to article 29 and the reiteration of the article from the appeal judgement.

I look forward to your reply and decision on how you will response to this case. I hope you consider to file a lawsuit to the HKPF on the behalf of the HKU students. Our legal system and constitution might be our final and only resolution left to save Hong Kong.

Regards,

An Ordinary University Student
